description: narrow lane with two trees; stone wall at L; buildings at L and R and in background; shadows from tree leaves on lane
inscription: LLC, in pencil: 716 木陰の道 (2)
signed: right below image, in pencil: T. Ryohei \'07
text: Throughout his career, Tanaka never wavered from his depiction of life in Japan, but he altered the perspectives he placed his viewer. In this print, he illustrates a sun-dappled road covered by an archway formed by two massive trees growing on either side. The houses on the side and at the end of the road have roof tiles and wooden sides of old architecture. Working with the limited palette of etching, Tanaka conveys the light pouring through the branches by varying the density of the leaves and using a spectrum of grays. One can imagine standing in the middle of the road, between the two trees, listening to the chirping of birds.
title: Roadway in Shade No. 2
